definition: household duties/housework

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means
even an honest and upright official will have difficulty resolving a family dispute (proverb)
pinyin: qing1 guan1 nan2 duan4 jia1 wu4 shi4

sentences.english: When I was doing the housework, my husband telephoned me from the office.
sentences.chinese: 當我正在幹家務時，我丈夫從辦公室打電話給我。

sentences.english: Will men participate more in household duties?
sentences.chinese: 男性會更多地參與家務勞動嗎？

sentences.english: Now Charlie knows that all BINGO Kids have to do chores.
sentences.chinese: 現在查理知道了，所有的賓果孩子們都要做家務。

sentences.english: However, some help with chores and contributions to shared food are expected.
sentences.chinese: 然而，客人可以幫忙做些家務活，一起分享食物。

sentences.english: I didn’t do anything, even housework.
sentences.chinese: 我什麼都沒做，甚至家務活都沒做。

sentences.english: Each time a child follows through with a task, he receives a sticker.
sentences.chinese: 每次孩子按照指示做完家務，他都會得到一個貼紙。

sentences.english: And while we’re talking about chores, the light in the basement burned out.
sentences.chinese: 既然在談家務事，地下室的燈泡燒壞了。

sentences.english: Housework done properly can kill you.
sentences.chinese: 適當地幹家務活會殺了你。

sentences.english: There’s still nothing much to do here, just watch TV or help with chores.
sentences.chinese: 在這裏仍然無事可做，除了看電視和幫忙做家務。

sentences.english: Happy man still should provide household job less as far as possible.
sentences.chinese: 快樂的丈夫還應該儘量少管家務事。

sentences.english: Your mother prefers to do her own housekeeping -- even if it is a little slapdash.
sentences.chinese: 即便有點精心馬虎了，你母親還是更喜歡自己做家務。

sentences.english: We spent the weekend pottering around the house.
sentences.chinese: 我們週末做一些瑣碎的家務事。

sentences.english: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.
sentences.chinese: 他觀察家務，並不吃閒飯。

sentences.english: At home, she ofter helps mother do the housework, and she likes reading a books.
sentences.chinese: 在家裏，她經常幫助媽媽做家務，讀一些她喜歡的書。

sentences.english: Her hands were roughened by housework.
sentences.chinese: 她的手由於家務勞動而變得粗糙。

definition: to prepare a meal/to cook
to support a family/to raise a family
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to clean/to sweep
to take care of one's family
to use one's brain
to take care of/to raise money/to attend to (guests, customers etc)
to work/to be employed
to cook
to prattle/to chatter away/to nag/garrulous/nagging
to do what one is told/obedient
daughter-in-law/wife (of a younger man)/young married woman/young woman
ordinarily/in normal times/in peacetime
bad thing/misdeed/to ruin things
to go to the kitchen (to prepare a meal)/to cook
to work hard/to look after
